name: Vegan Black Bean Soup
description: 30 minutes is all you need to make this simple, creamy and delicious Vegan Black Bean Soup! Serve with vegan sour cream, tortilla chips or perhaps my vegan cornbread.
recipeIngredient: 4 (15-ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed
1 teaspoon hot sauce, or more to taste
1/2  teaspoon  salt, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oil in a large soup pot over medium heat, then add the onion and saute for about 3 minutes until translucent. Add the garlic and saute 1 more minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the diced carrot and celery, and saute for 1 minute, stirring. Pour in the beans, vegetable broth and cumin. Bring to a boil, then lower heat to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Blend some of the soup: Put 3 cups of the soup in a blender, and blend until smooth. Add back to the pot and stir. Alternately, you can use an immersion blender to blend some of the soup right in the pot.
